For a quick comparison, I took the same composition on both cameras, flash and without flash, and the TS3 comes out light years ahead in resolution, color quality, lack of fringing and jpeg side effects, etc., let alone the video, location features, and many more. So, onward to the new camera, old one goes off to auction somewhere or maybe I'll give it to my daughter.Played with the TS3 a little taking shots and videos of the dogs, just to get the feel of it. The user interface is similar to the Nikon and many other cameras of this type, so I had no problems learning the basics. I haven't dunked it in the pool yet; that will wait for the next warm weather water opportunity. But I did take it on a hike today to test the GPS and Intelligent Auto mode. For the most part GPS was pretty accurate. I took along my 'real' outdoors GPS receiver that I know is accurate to less than 10 feet or so, and then compared the GPS metadata in the pictures by plotting waypoints for each picture overlaid on the GPS track of the 3-mile or so hike with my spouse and our dogs. She took the pictures and turned the camera off and on a few times, with the GPS set to 'always on.' Most of the 20 or so photos were spot on, but one came out positioned about 50 feet northeast of the track. Then the GPS seemed to stop working, and the last few jumped to a single point about 15 miles southeast of the true position. Not sure what happened there; nothing different about tree cover or clouds, and the outdoors receiver continued to work. Could have been related to turning the camera off long enough for the GPS to deactivate, and then not waiting long enough after powering back on to get a good fix. We didn't look at the displayed GPS status so it's hard to say. Next time I'll try to pay more attention. Anyway, GPS seems to work very well when it was working and properly initialized.Intelligent Auto mode had no problem switching to macro mode when close to some mushrooms, and the rest of the photos of medium to long-range objects were fine. The flash functioned well on macro and normal shots. Overall exposure was accurate, although underexposed by ~ 1/2 stop. Auto white balance was correct for the overcast day.Leaving GPS on almost all the time, taking about 50 photos (maybe 40% flash) and around 10 mins of HD video, the battery is less than half used.Overall I'm very satisfied with the DMC-TS3 performance. Next challenge -- using it underwater or in other adverse conditions where I wouldn't dare take my SLR. Oh, now I need to find a vacation...

Reviews.Title: Not Perfect, but a Really Good Water Resistant Camera
Reviews.Author: K. Ako
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic DMC-TS3 is a very good camera for the application it was designed for. It excels in photography during bad weather, on the beach, swimming pool, hiking, etc...This is a perfect complement to my Nikon DSLR because this camera can go places that I dare not take a multi Kilo$ DSLR. I purchased this camera to replace an ancient Pentax Optio 33WR & the electronics in the TS3 are many generations ahead of my old camera.The shutter lag is very short for a point & shoot. The TS3 is a full featured camera that is very likeable.Many people read reviews to see the bad stuff, so here are a few things I found irritating:1. There is no optical viewfinder as there is on my old Pentax 33WR. A viewfinder is very helpful when bright ambient light (usually outdoors, where this camera was designed to operate!) washes out the LCD screen. However, this is a common problem with every current generation water resistant camera I have seen, regardless of who the manufacturer is.2. The Panasonic uses a proprietary rechargeable battery. My old Pentax used AA NiMH rechargeables or even alkalines in a pinch. When traveling, especially internationally, the AA battery is found everywhere. Commonality comes in handy if your battery fails. Again, this is a common problem with every current generation water resistant camera I have seen.3. While photographing some furniture indoors, I noticed a lot more glare being picked up with the TS3 than I could see with my own eyes. I am not sure if this is the cause, but there is no IR filter in front of the CMOS sensor! This may be common to many point & shoots. My Nikon DSLR does not do this.4. In general, the images are a little on the soft side.Other things that I found useful:1. Olympus sells a competent Neoprene Sport Case (Olympus 202320) that fits the Panasonic TS3 like it was made for it. Excellent scratch protection. It is sold on Amazon for $6.82 on the date of this review. Great price Amazon!2. Amazon also sells "Wasabi Power Battery and Charger Kit for Panasonic... TS3", consisting of 2 batteries & a charger. So far everything works well with this kit & is a bargain at $29.99.Bottom line is that I do recommend this camera. The shortcomings are common to all water resistant cameras of this generation, not just with Panasonic. This so happens to be one of the best if not the best water resistant point & shoot camera available during the time of this review.

Reviews.Title: DMC TS3 - Six months, leaking, still working
Reviews.Author: westerndiver
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for six months, using it when I go sailing, diving, and general travelling.I'll echo what everyone else says about size and general durability. It's size makes it a great traveller and it can take a lot of abuse. I love this camera.But what I found out is that though this camera is marketed as waterproof, it's not really. The double lock door and little rubber gaskets do an admirable job of keeping water out and under most conditions it will likely stay dry, but Panasonic would have take it another notch up to make it really waterproof under field conditions.So here's some tips:- If you're going snorkeling or diving, use some waterproof athletic tape to help the door stay in place. I think that's why mine leaked, the roughhousing you find in the water probably jarred it just enough to seep.- Before you open the camera's access door Make Sure the Camera is DRY. The natural tendency is to open the door face up which means any water hiding in the door or gasket goes into the camera. Use a paper towel, newspaper, or toilet paper to dry the door area then open it face down.- If you get corrosion on the contacts, use a product called DEOXIT(RadioShack). Works great.- If you find water in the camera, Don't Turn It On (you knew that). Take everything out and let it dry for a couple of days. Mine came back to life with no problems.One of these days I'll do something to this camera and it'll croak for good, and in a heartbeat I'll buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera, huge disappointment
Reviews.Author: Stainless
Reviews.Content: I looked hard at waterproof cameras.  Narrowed it down to this ant the AW NIkon.  Went with this camera as it seemed to have better reviews, and Nikon was new to the weather proof market.  Plus I had another Panasonic Point and shoot that I was happy with.  The main reason for buying it was we were going going snorkeling on a cruise to Mexico and Central America.  The camera worked great the first day, shot some great underwater pics while snorkeling in Cozumel.  Please note the camera was as new, I had not dropped it.  The next day we were in Belize looking forward to snorkeling on their Barrier Reef.  I was taking pictures.  Pulled it out of my pocket and could not see an image on the screen.  I hit the play button and the camera played back the image I took minutes before.  I reset the camera, messed with settings and finally called Panasonic who told me after diagnosing over the phone that the CCD went out.  Wow, here I am on vacation in Central America and I am hosed.  They said send it in for repair.  I said I would like a refund as I need to buy another camera for my trip.  They said sorry, repair is the only option.  I have never been this disappointed with an electronic gadget.  I knew I should of went with the NIkon.  Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Not sure what I'm missing
Reviews.Author: sue
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on the reviews which were positive for the most part. I've given it time to grow on me, but it's just not working out. I find the zoom and option buttons very clunky. In the days of touch screen and easy scroll, this set up feels like old technology. That's manageable and can be overlooked IF the camera took good pictures, but it doesn't. The only time it takes decent pictures is outside on a bright sunny day. Otherwise the picture quality is poor at best. The images are grainy and have terrible exposure problems. I thought the saving grace might be the underwater feature, but I guess they mean ONLY underwater. When the camera is wet (but not underwater), the lens gets foggy and all your pictures have a foggy haze over them. I'll say MAYBE I got a lemon, but for the price, this lemon juice really stings!

Reviews.Title: Camera stopped working.
Reviews.Author: Carol Hayes
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera in August 2011 and had used it as a regular camera for a month or so and it worked fine, but when I took in the water with me to use it for the reason I bought it, ... to take underwater pictures, it didn't last very long. I was using it underwater (snorkeling) and got five or six good pictures underwater when it just suddenly stopped working.  Afterwards, I tried to do the washing in clean fresh water like it says to do after having it in ocean water.  I then let it set for a long time hoping what ever water might be in it would drain out and / or dry ..... but it never started working again.  It is now an expensive paperweight.

Reviews.Title: Only buy this camera if you really need waterproof capability
Reviews.Author: Soichi Hayashi
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading about its good image quality and 1080p video capability that's worth paying the premium for. However, it turned out that it was really just a over priced digital camera with most of the cost is to provide the waterproof capability. This is not a good digital camera & video camera that happens to be waterproof, but rather, just a *waterproof* mediocre digital camera.I have returned it, and currently looking for a much cheaper digital camera that can take better or just as good still photos & videos as this camera.

Reviews.Title: Will stand up to my 3 Year Old and 5 Year Old!
Reviews.Author: D. B. Pegalis "I have been a member since aro...
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo54HFM14SL2ZR', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo54HFM14SL2ZRloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_mo54HFM14SL2ZRpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo54HFM14SL2ZRpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/812wCdWHAdS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo54HFM14SL2ZRcurrentClick) { return cv_mo54HFM14SL2ZRcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:08 MinsI actually own the TS-1 and bought it a couple of years ago when I left my other camera in a cab in San Francisco trip. I had to search for another rugged camera and then we took a cab to the camera store to buy it. At the time it was much more expensive then what the TS-3 is now on Amazon. My husband choked but at the time our son and daughter were even younger. They like to grab mommy's camera and take pictures...needless to say they are both dropping it constantly on various surfaces including concrete. I can tell you it has taken a lot of abuse from those 2 and it is still taking pictures. Of course you don't buy a small camera like this to take the best pictures you have...you buy it because of it's size and ease of use. I think the pictures are good enough. The underwater part is also great when you want to take pics of the kids under the water and they turn out great.I have the orange one and love the color.THIS VIDEO IS FROM THE TS-1 underwater...if this one is this good...I imagine the TS-3 would be much better.

Reviews.Title: capable off-road camera
Reviews.Author: Lyle A. Wilkinson "retired"
Reviews.Content: I traded in a Panasonic TS2 and Panasonic FZ28 for the TS3 and am very happy.  I was using the TS2 more and more and the FZ28 less because of the slip in a pocket convenience.  Main reason for switch was promise of better picture quality, gps was a useful bonus.  With TS2 two batteries got me through a 3 week trip.  I've ordered 2 more batteries for the TS3.  My most demanding use is kayaking and the TS2  would fog under the lens cover after a week in the damp.  I plan to overnight the TS3 in a Pelican box with desiccant.The pictures do appear better than from the TS2 and on par with FZ28.  I miss the bigger zoom and view finder of the FZ28.  So far I haven't missed the extra pixels of the older cameras. With the TS2 80% of my poor quality pictures were operator error, with the TS3 90% of my poor quality pictures are operator error.Biggest problem is, in certain situations screen acts as mirror and picture target is obscured.  All of the waterproof gps and cameras I've used have this screen mirror problem.

Reviews.Title: Great unless it gets in the water!!
Reviews.Author: Andrew & Blake's mommy
Reviews.Content: We have had this camera for about 9 months.  It takes beautiful pictures both insides and out.  It is fairly easy to use and set up.  It fits in my husband's pocket, which is a must when we travel.  The screen is large and makes it easy to see the shot you are trying to get.  It has also proven to be pretty shock resistant as it has been dropped several times and banged on walls - all by accident as we move through the day with luggage and a young child.Now, with all of the nice things said about this camera (I am not technical nor a photography expert so I cannot give specific details on more advanced features), this camera is NOT water proof.  My husband has taken it kayaking, so it did get splashed on and it had no problems but either did our last non-waterproof camera with this activity.  The problem happened last month when we decided to take it snorkeling.  Well, it was in about 6 inches of water (since we were still getting positioned) and it took 3 pictures (which did survive) and it died - black screened on us.  We thought okay, it needs to dry out and get some rest, as if it had a hard day and needed some time to reflect on how to go forward. Well, letting our little blue camera rest and dry out did not help it.  It was utterly and totally dead!!We called the warranty department and got a very nice young lady to help us with the procedure on returning the camera for repairs.  We sent the camera to them by priority mail and one week later the status online said that they had not received it.  We called them again and they said it was there probably but they have a BACKLOG of this particular camera so they will get to it as soon as possible.  This was a huge red flag for us and one that I wish would have been in bold letters on the product page!!  :)  The helpful people, which they were every time we contacted them, called us three days later and left a message saying that they could not repair the camera and they were sending us a replacement.Our camera got water in the lens, the flash, and the battery case - it smelled burnt and took two days for the lens to dry out.  It was toast.I would have gladly given this camera 1 star but I feel as though since the company stood behind their product then they deserve my 3 star rating.  With that said though, we will not use this camera in water again.  I would not recommend this product for its intended use of being water proof/resistant and it is too expensive for a point and click camera since you can get the basic features on far less expensive models.  There are plenty of people who have not had this difficulty but I would read through the reviews carefully before you decide to purchase this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera, great price
Reviews.Author: motornutt
Reviews.Content: We purchased the camera last minute before a recent trip to Hawaii.  This camera works very weil above and below water.  We took many stills and videos with it in many different conditions - sunlight, rain, on the water, below the water and they came out great.  The camera functions very well and is easily adjustable through the autoamtic condition settings as well as manual settings.  The camera did fog up on the inside of the lens one time while it was left on for an extended period of time.  My guess was that I did not let it dry out enough after rinsing it off.  We just turned the camera off and opened the door for about 10 minutes and it cleared up, and did not have the problem again.  The only suggestion I would make for improvement would be a better zoom that the 4.6x and an included carrying case - but for the price, I guess you can't have everything.

Reviews.Title: Definitely better than other options
Reviews.Author: JMcC
Reviews.Content: I have tested other rugged point&shoots; and this one was the best by far. The picture quality was comparable to non-rugged point&shoots.; I've dropped it, taken underwater pictures and been outside in very cold and wet weather and the camera works well. I do follow the camera's instructions on cleaning and drying the camera. The camera provides reminders on locking the latch to the battery compartment religiously, (almost annoyingly) but it helps you double check; so that your waterproof seal is tight and no damage occurs to the camera.PRO's: does what it says - takes good pictures in sun light, decent low-light and underwater pictures. Very sturdy design. Easy to use video recording button (although could be a little bit bigger), good range of pictures options (portrait, landscape, macro etc.), Great range in protection (-10C, 6 ft drop, 40 ft deep in water).CONS: a little slow to start up, lens can get foggy in certain situations (mine fogged up a little when taking underwater pictures in a very humid climate, but I followed their care instructions and fogging went away). Odd choices given in picture size: Either you take tiny picture (around 300K) or huge (nothing smaller than 5MB, then 12MB) :S Also one annoyance for me because I use a Mac, the AVCHD mode does not play (because the software is not Mac compatible)Overall: I would recommend this camera. Although it has it's quirks, it works very well.

Reviews.Title: Super heavy duty, but just an Ok camera
Reviews.Author: Harmony
Reviews.Content: This camera was stolen so I only had a few months to use it, but I was never very happy with the image quality. And every time you turn on the camera it takes awhile and then you have to dismiss the message that pops up asking if you want to view the underwater instructions. It was annoying. I don't recommend this camera. The auto white balance often led to bad lighting and often pixelated images.I highly recommend the canon d10 underwater camera. It's much easier to use and better image quality.

Reviews.Title: good stuff for traveling
Reviews.Author: Gennady
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for winter using, the previous camera has freeze on below temperature, but now I found that camera has really good HD video possibility, on that reason we left at house our handy cam at all.On this summer we're in Swiss alps and used it too as backup camera and as video cam. Overall all the pictures that were taken are in good enough quality the best in mid light conditions.The only one thing that should be taken in mind is to put attention on not get your finger to touch the objective (really not convenient put it on the corner) and check if it not get it "muddy".Very fast writing speed (using recommended memory card).Now I'm not afraid to give the camera to my little daughters (they like use it very much).

Reviews.Title: great waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: T. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: we had the canon D10, which was also a great camera, but lost it on one of our trips.Replaced it with this one.  For a point and shoot, both picture and video quality are quite good (just don't expect DSLR or micro 4/3ths quality).  As expected for this camera range, low light pictures are grainy.  Built quality is excellent:  camera feels solid and substantial.We used the camera quite a bit in and under water on a recent trip:  no issues at all.  As with ALL waterproof cameras, reading the instructions on camera care is a must!  (ie., soak in tap water for 10 minutes -> then dry -> would only then open any of the camera's slots/doors.  Check for sand/dirt in the rubber seals before closing, etc).Had a camera for close to 6 months.  No issues.compared to the Canon D10:  the TS3 felt more solid than the D10.  The D10's "bulge" at the lens did make it bulky compared to this one.  Picture quality between the 2 cameras are pretty much equal.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Marylander
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so we can take it down to USVI/St. Thomas and use it under water during snorkeling.  After 5-10 minutes under water, the camera LCD view started blinking and no more pictures can be taken.  I took it back to the condo, rinsed off the salt, opened it up to dry it out, and it worked again.  This happens every day in underwater conditions.  It tells me the waterproofing capability is not strictly true.  I have already read the instructions and took more precautions than recommended.  It was on my wrist at all times so its not under more than 3-4 feet of water.  I had high hopes of getting more use out of this camera, but each day just dashed my hopes more.I can only use it out of water, but it's basically useless under water, hence 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: I expected a lot less
Reviews.Author: Jim Moore
Reviews.Content: When I buy a ruggedized waterproof camera, one expects a camera that has stiff sluggish controls, is clunky, but the ability to take 'acceptable' but not great underwater pictures. Surprise!Meet the TS3. This is a camera I LOVE.I bought it without doing much research, I was in a hurry to find something for a trip to Bahia de los Angeles, a place known for whale sharks. The first morning there, I woke to a hubbub of activity, whale sharks had been seen close to shore. I grabbed the camera and within moments had taken a shot of my lifetime of my girlfriend hitching a ride with a huge whale shark! The underwater shot was beautiful. Although I admit there had been a moment of panic of putting the camera under water, there was nothing to fear.Since then I have taken beautiful shots in the rain, and in a rain forest in Hawaii. I never worry if it will make it through. Note though, I FOLLOW the DIRECTIONS for the procedures to be waterproof. If you don't, the camera will flood, as would specialized waterproof cases costing thousands of dollars!!!The camera is now the only camera I normally carry unless I need my DSLR. Of course, with the DSLR, I also need to carry my Garmin 60 and run all the pictures through GPS tagging software (all my photos are geotagged).This is a great P&S.; And also, it's waterproof (to 40 feet, optional 120ft case), has GPS, and is very rugged. You can't ask for much more.Weaknesses: Low light photography is difficult.Note: Get a FLOATING HAND-STRAP, well worth the $8 and has saved my camera twice so far. Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS3 Digital Camera Underwater Accessory Kit Floating Foam Strap

Reviews.Title: From the Tropics to the Arctic in 2 Months
Reviews.Author: Donald J. Kinney "DJ"
Reviews.Content: So this isn't a sweet little wafer thin camera for grandma. When you buy it, know what you're getting--and that's a camera designed for adventure travel and ruggedness. The image quality is very good, but it isn't pro. If you want that, buy a Canon or Nikon.This camera--within two months after purchasing it--went underwater in a pool in the tropics, in the rain in Boston, above the Arctic Circle on Grimsey in Iceland (all around Iceland) and even, against my better judgment, in the extremely harsh conditions of a chemical pool at Blue Lagoon. It saw Rome and took wonderful 3D pictures and then came back to Florida. What I'm saying is, underwater, Greenland sea, steamy tropics, everything. Never had a problem.Oh, and the only mark it ended up with from all of those adventures is a set of scratches from when it hit the bottom of a pool and it was retrieved by scraping it across the concrete.VERY tough.

Reviews.Title: Cool camera!
Reviews.Author: thuang
Reviews.Content: Getting started on learning how to scuba-dive, I would definitely want to snap some pictures when I'm down in the water.  Based on the manufacturer specifications, I think this one has the best water-proofing capacity compared to other water-proof, shock proof cameras currently on the market.  Essentially, this would be a perfect camera if you are not too terribly picky on the picture quality, and would like to take pictures WHEREVER you go, no matter what the environment may be throwing at you.  The following is my 2 cents on the camera:Pros:-Water-proof depth (40 ft/12 meters), shock and freeze proof, and has a very ruggedly-built look.-GPS (which is a good and bad thing, but definitely handy in Picasa if you want to remember where you've been in the world.)-Great outdoor pictures, and full-HD video with auto focus/zooming function when shooting.-Various modes for different photo-shooting conditions.  For the most part, using the iA (Intelligent Auto) mode will suffice.-Leica lens is always great.Cons:-Slow response from GPS (indoor, mostly) When outdoor, the GPS seems to pick up quickly (firmware version 1.2 would help.  It drains the battery as well, so you might want to use Airplane mode to reduce battery drain even when the camera is off.  The latest firmware can be found here:[...]-Indoor picture isn't as good. (OK, but not great)-I wish they had a len cover when the camera is off.Overall, I am really happy with the purchase, and although I haven't officially taken pictures during scuba dives, a bunch of pictures in my bath tub showed that the water-proofing is working so far.  Can't wait to take it out for a real test.  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Ideal and has taken some great shots!
Reviews.Author: Andrew "Andrew"
Reviews.Content: The first camera arrived within two days and worked perfectly until I needed to download the video to my MAC. The USB did not work. Amazon shipped a replacement and it arrived the same day (two days later) that I was able to get the old one shipped! Works perfectly. Downloading pictures is easy to iPhoto but video has to be downloaded to iMovie and that takes longer than our other camera (iPhoto takes care of both pictures and video with that one).I have already used it under water in the local YMCA pool and it worked great, both pictures and video. The quality was much better than the $10 disposables. We have taken it to the zoo and a couple of Fairs. I was never concerned about dirt, moisture or getting it knocked. It has worked as expected in all conditions.Remember that it's not a $1000 camera and that there are limitations to the rugged design. Its picture quality is no better than a camera half its price. It's bulkier and a little heavier than most digital cameras; but nothing that causes problems. You are limited with distance with the flash. Remember the limitations and there are no problems.The GPS is a little slow locating itself. Recommendation: Take a minute whenever you arrive somewhere to get the GPS set asap. Don't wait until you want to take a picture! The battery has lasted about a day of regular use and the GPS permanently on. With it staying on it locates itself far quicker.We are going on a cruise in a few weeks and I will update this review if needed; so far this is a highly recommended camera that will do more and take more abuse than most of us will do with it!****************************************************************************************************************************August 2012 Update:The camera greatly surpassed our hopes for the cruise and we came back with some great shots. The waterproof feature held up in surf, snorkeling as well as dust and rain. We have taken it to Charleston beaches several times and it recently survived waves and sand castle building (in the sand) without any issues. Everyone is impressed with what we expose this camera to. Still highly recommended. The GPS is great and the battery lasts better than any other electronic device we've owned, several days of on and off use. Hard to quantify because it will depend on how long you leave it on, use the zoom, preview pictures as you take them etc.

Reviews.Title: It Really is Waterproof.
Reviews.Author: yaksister
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after acquiring a sea kayak with medium stability, which mean I spend more time in the water for now.  I carry it in a pocket in my life jacket. This camera has been in the water for up to 10 minutes at a time never more than a few feet from the surface. Picture quality, very good from the gitgo although not quite a good as my other Lumix (not waterproof), was not affected by being submerged.  I carry a lens cleaning cloth in a drybag so that I can soak up water spots from the lens before taking pictures after a dip.  The zoom is not a strong as I would like, but I can compensate in post production to create a closer image and still maintain good sharpness.  The size is very manageable whether in my purse or lifejacket pocket. I've gotten used to the separate zoom and wide angle buttons; so not a timing issue.  Overall, this is a very nice camera even without the ability to be submerged.  I did purchase the floatable camera strap--although waterproof, this camera does not float on its own.  I would highly recommend this camera to others. It gives me the ablity to take quality pictures in places where I cannot take my other camera without great risk to their life.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Dierick
Reviews.Content: Rugged, easy to use... great value. Picture a bit soft in low light situations but other than that Great cameraUpdate:more than 15 dives after, still going and doing great. I`ve taken it up to 35ft and no issues and great pictures. Still on the soft side on low light enviroments underwater, but great product.

Reviews.Title: Great all around camera!
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: We were headed to the islands and I wanted a waterproof camera I could take with me everywhere so I didn't have to worry about it being stolen when I was in the water. I also didn't want that goofy looking Cannon competitor version.Turns out this camera is the best digital camera I've ever purchased. It's very intuitive and easy to use. Water proofing was flawless for snorkeling and in the pool. Battery life was very good..I did purchase a second battery, but didn't really need it. The GPS feature will drain the battery much quicker if you leave it on all the time. One of my favorite features was the instant slide show built into the camera. Just plug it in and play your pics and video on screen with background music and fade in fade out along with plenty of other transitions.It would be nice to have a few more sound tracks for the slide show as it repeats after a very short time.I know everyone thinks mobile phones will obsolete cameras, but let's face it, cell phones are a convenience. it will be a long time before they'll have the functionality of this camera.My only real complaint is that they should have included the HDMI output cable with the camera. They are cheap enough and the output is sooooo much better than the standard video out. One other wish is that they provide Mac compatible software..only Windows software is packaged. I purchased Adobe Photoshop/Premier bundle for $99 with a $30 rebate, which blows away anything they could have packaged with the camera anyway.

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot..!
Reviews.Author: Jupp Norhausen
Reviews.Content: I am on the water a lot. Dropped the camera into the bilge, no problem. Pictures are of excellent quality (up to 13x19"). If you dropped a camera and had to buy a new one, why not just by a good one and keep it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Matthew Beach
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife a few years ago, and it still works great. The display on the LCD screen has a slight lag, but the pictures always come out beautiful. i have dropped the camera a few times, and the resulting damage is only a few dings here and there. I've taken it swimming and snorkeling, and never had any problems with this this. DEFINITELY recommend picking up a foam flaoting strap with this thing in case you drop it underwater.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Abby Del Valle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when i was going on a cruise and at the time i had compared it with the GoPro and it was a better option at the time. GoPro was more video and i wanted more photo while still being able to shoot HD video at 1080p. Now, 3 years later i ended up getting a GoPro 3+ Black edition but I still have my Panasonic Lumix and won't get rid of it, I love this camera because the the quality of the video and the pictures are great! The GoPro i use as an action camera but when not doing sports, casual or going places i take my Lumix.

Reviews.Title: if waterproof is important avoid this camera and the new ts5 as well
Reviews.Author: J. Solberg
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in 2011 to take to the Mayan Riviera snorkeling.Pro's: took some very acceptable photos and video while it lasted.Cons:before leaving for the Mexico trip for which this camera was purchased, i filmed about 15 minutes underwater in the Canadian Rockies when fly-fishing, no problem (amazing video actually, was very pleased and excited at this point).then a month later, used it snorkeling near Playa Del Carmen. First snorkel trip of about an hour - no problem. Followed the direction for care to a "T", rinsing, cleaning, allowing to dry, etc. The next day, took it to Xel-Ha, and noticed the minute i turned it on that there was a fog/smudge  showing up  in the display and lens. within 5 minutes, it started blinking on and off, then gave a bunch of lines, and finally just died.I notice that many have had almost identical experiences with not only this model, but EVERY subsequent model... more then 10% of all purchased (see the 1 star ratings to verify for yourself)I am heading back to the Maya Riviera this fall, but am at a loss as to what I will do. Am considering a housing for my canon dSLR, but wife says no way - too much money for the housing (thousands) and too much money for the camera! I am currently considering the new Olympus TG-3 which will be released in a few weeks.  but to be honest - I don't have a lot of confidence anymore in "rugged waterproof" cameras. thanks Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: nice!!
Reviews.Author: LEONARDO JOSE SEBBA
Reviews.Content: new product as advertised, perfect! I really liked it and a new experience! Thank you. recommend with 100% success !

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph J Melago
Reviews.Content: Takes very good photos underwater and on land. I highly recommend this camera. Works great in all conditions. Easy to operate. Will be taking on vacation to the beach soon.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Some1whotrustsreviews
Reviews.Content: Been using this camera for almost three years now and what can I say this thing is amazing! I've taken this camera on dozens of trips from whitewater kayaking in West Virginia and Canada to snorkeling in Hawaii and it has never let me down!Pros:TRULY waterproof, never had a drop of water get insideTakes great picturesColor makes it easy to findRechargeable battery is great and lasts for lots of pictures1080p video looks awesomeLots of different picture modes for pretty much any situationShock resistant feature has worked from the small drops that I've had with itCons:Pictures routinely come out a little soft and therefore require some editingNeutral:While I expect that the camera itself will withstand freezing temperatures I've always been skeptical of the battery being able to do so. So I've always slept with this camera in my bag whenever the temps are supposed to go down below freezing.*Note: I did manage to crack the glass on the screen while rock climbing, I was dumb and sat right on it, but Panasonic replaced it free of charge!*All in all you can't go wrong with this camera! It is one of the first things that I pack to take with me on every trip!

Reviews.Title: no cousomer care what so ever
Reviews.Author: russell bradshaw
Reviews.Content: The camera is actually great, except you have to replace the door seal every year or so, problem is, that's impossible. Every time I call the 800 number their web sight says to call one of two things happen, the person on the phone has no idea what I'm talking about or I am told I called the wrong number and am put on hold infinitely. I e-mailed customer service and complained and asked for a solution and got a canned response to "Mail your product in and we will fix/repaired any issues. are they kidding? I'd never see my camera again.Get a Cannon or Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Do not Buy!
Reviews.Author: James Cook
Reviews.Content: Leaked after 2 years.  Its Outside the warranty and Im not gonna pay the $180 everyone is claiming that is will require to be fixed.  Its going in the trash.  Its a disposable $350 camera.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 2 years, died at a bad time
Reviews.Author: Ken W.
Reviews.Content: OK, so reading the 1-star reviews I consider myself lucky that this expensive camera lasted 2 whole years.  Of course, it died in the middle of a vacation where I wanted to take pictures snorkeling, and couldn't.  I had it in the ocean once before, and it was used many times in the pool, but it died within minutes of it's second trip to the ocean.  It was never deeper than 10', and it died in 3' of water.  The seals were clean, and undamaged, so they just don't last (and when you look at the seals, even when new, it's a miracle they would ever work.)

Reviews.Title: versatile, easy to use, rugged camera.
Reviews.Author: rdmjr
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to use my son't TS3 on a trip to Northern Canada to take pictures of the northern lights.  In temperatures of below zero, the camera worked flawlessly.  You need a spare battery because when it gets cold the battery loses power.  The camera sports a huge choice of 26 different mode scene options, including starry sky allowing options of 15, 30, and 60 seconds, which I used successfully to take some awesome pictures of the northern lights.  (The newer TS4 does not have as many choices of scene modes)  Moreover, I found the camera quite intuitive and easy to use once you get to know it.  An overall great rugged camera for the active person even if you don't plan to use it underwater.

Reviews.Title: waterproof and good picture quality
Reviews.Author: tamarinera "tamarinera"
Reviews.Content: Need a waterproofie, and this is the best, I think. I see lots of other folks with it, so I'm not alone in that opinion. Nice options, good color quality. It took some doing to find how to put the shutter speed on unlimited (like it stays open as long as you hold the button down), but I eventually found that too. Menu isn't the most intuitive, but it's got all the features once  you learn where they are. Totally recommendable.

Reviews.Title: Dust-proof, too.
Reviews.Author: Samuel Baughman
Reviews.Content: This is my go-to camera for trips into dusty environments, such as the desert. It's also been fun to play with at the pool, although in-water use is just a bonus for me. The GPS can be a little slow to lock onto your location, but if you have the patience you'll get tagged photos which are great for reconstructing routes and setups once you're back at a computer.

Reviews.Title: Rugged, but picture quality is only so-so
Reviews.Author: tmann
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace an older Canon digital camera, a PowerShot SD770IS (10 MP).  That camera died as the result of moisture intrusion during our honeymoon, which sucked.  Not wanting that to happen again, I sought out to buy a waterproof camera.  At the time, this seemed to be the best option available.  The camera does seem to be rugged and waterproof, so it was successful from that point of view.However, the picture quality of the camera is not very great.  It is difficult to get crisp shots unless you are outdoors in bright light.  Even then, when you review the pictures you shot, if you zoom in on any of them, they quickly get blurry.  It's like even though it's 12.1 MP, it's really not much better than a 3 MP camera, because you can't zoom in to take advantage of the quality anyways.  Indoor/low light performance of this camera is terrible.This camera was a letdown, but we ended up keeping it for vacations and wet use anyways.  For normal shooting, we wanted something better, so we bought a newer model (at the time) Canon, the SX230HS.  That camera is awesome - the shot quality and low light performance is really good.I also generally like Canon's menus and UI much better.  I found the DMC-TS3's menus to be a little confusing and "clunky".

Reviews.Title: STURDY, nice pictures
Reviews.Author: Danielle Underwood
Reviews.Content: I scuba, spearfish and surf. I've had this thing under to 60ft still with no problems. It is built like a little tank and takes really nice photos. It is very quick to use: boots from off to on very fast, plus it has a picture button and a separate movie record button which makes things really easy esp under water when you don't want to fuss with switching modes, etc. Simple, sturdy. Prob the best underwater dig camera of its type, yet.

Reviews.Title: Great for water and snow and all outside shots
Reviews.Author: Matt Gregory
Reviews.Content: This camera works great for what I bought it for...Snowboarding. The bonus is that its very cool to take underwater pics as well. The only downside i can think of is that indoor and low-light shots can be very challenging.

Reviews.Title: Good in all but low light conditions
Reviews.Author: K L Dye
Reviews.Content: This was purchased as a gift for my husband, and we have enjoyed probably 2 years of use. This is a durable, rugged camera with a quality feel to it. In addition to the usual point and shoot competency, the camera zooms well for shooting distant things, and it does macro really well for close-up subjects. However, we were disappointed in image quality in twilight and low light conditions - we could only get grainy, blurry shots using the built-in low-light setting, or flash-glare shots if we engage the flash. Sadly, our cellphones take much better shots in low-light. This camera now gets used primarily on road trips where the ruggedness is important - for day to day snapshots, we're just using our cellphone cameras nowadays.

Reviews.Title: Best Canera Ever
Reviews.Author: Angela Madussi
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, takes awesome pictures, is tough as hell and easy to use.Would recommend it to any outdoors person.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera that can hold a beating.
Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera that can hold a beating and can dive. However, the quality of the pictures is not greatAfter using it over a year I have 2 big complains:The video sound is horrible! The location of they mic is on top so good luck getting nice volume on the video.The second is the location of the lens: usually gets dirty with my fingers and get blurry pictures. Requires constant cleaningIf I had to do it again probably wouldn't buy this item.

Reviews.Title: Good Tough Camera
Reviews.Author: Semperwise
Reviews.Content: This camera has been tough as nails so far.  The kids (and me too) have dropped it repeatedly on hard surfaces and it chugs right along.  It's been in the ocean, pool, lake, even volcanic hot springs, and it has performed beautifully.  Picture quality is good, not breathtaking but good.  Video quality is pretty good.  I love that this thing allows you to zoom in and out while doing video.  Maybe that's standard on most cameras but this is the first I've seen it myself from a point and shoot.  The proprietary battery is one drawback to this unit, though I get a good amount of life out of the battery.  Because you have to use the battery pack, there is no going to standard batteries in an emergency, you are just out of luck if you don't have a charged battery pack.  I did have trouble with a super high capacity SD card (32gigs), but it could have been the fault of the card (it was unusable in the camera for some reason).  The high capacity cards were too expensive at the time to get multiples to try.  I generally use a 16gig card which has had no problems at all, and I've used numerous smaller capacity cards with no problems as well.  I would definitely buy this again, though I would like to see a night-shot option put in.

Reviews.Title: Great all round camera
Reviews.Author: Gerrrit61
Reviews.Content: I have being using this camera for over a year and it is great! Still use it in the pool and in the rain on our dog walks to the beach. I do not leave the house without it. I use it to document the restoration if my truck  and it gets quite a beating in the shop.Great durable camera. I wish it had a better zoom but I guess you can't have it all

Reviews.Title: Fantastic underwater photos
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: I have taken this camera on multiple trips to Costa Rica, Colorado, North Carolina, Orlando, Virginia Beach, and others.  So far, I love it.  In Costa Rica, I took it snorkeling nearly every day down to about 20-25 feet.  I have never had any issues with water leaking into it.  Also, it has sat on a blanket in the sand during trips to North Carolina and Virginia Beach with no issues.  In Orlando, it was put under the water to take some photos of the sting rays.  Each time, I washed it off with fresh water soon after and everything has been ok.I have also dropped this camera once from a height of about 3 feet.  While the SD card inside has had issues every sense, the camera has not.Photos are generally clear and better than I expected from an underwater camera.  While they don't compare to an SLR, I still feel I made the best purchase for a camera with the features I was requiring for frequent travel.The one issue I have seen is with the CCD screen and reflects of the sun off of water.  I first though I may have broke the camera when some strange lines starting appearing when I focused at the a body of water.  It turned out to just be the reflection of the sun was causing the CCD to go a little haywire.  The pictures turned out fine.I have also used this for video and got some decent video of riding on the back of a 4-wheeler.  I would recommend this to anyone looking for a rugged camera that can be used to snorkel or take with you while hiking.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely stoked
Reviews.Author: GARTH STEPHENS
Reviews.Content: By far and away the best compact digital I have brought for my travels. I am aware I can get ones that will take better pictures, however balances need to be made with regards to environments etc, and did a lot of research prior to purchasing.This camera is living up to every bit of it's reviews and ratings as 'best in class'.

Reviews.Title: lives up to it's marketing
Reviews.Author: Rednax85
Reviews.Content: This camera is as rugged as advertised. It's been banged around on various trips to the beach, hiking, riding. Always turns out fine. The pictures are pretty good - I'd guess typical for a point-and-shoot. Overall, I like it.

Reviews.Title: Best compact rugged camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Cook
Reviews.Content: I had tried several other sport cameras and this one has worked the best for me.  Easy to understand menus.  Fast photos.  Good resolution.  This is my general use camera.

Reviews.Title: Died after 2 weeks of used
Reviews.Author: Pepo "Pepo"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in July 2011 and payed $300 for it at Amazon.  I used it for one week in and out of the water, it worked fine.  I used it for less than a week in 2012 out of the water only.  I planned to use it in 2013 during my week of vacation in Antigua but the screen froze on the second day while I opened it in the water and that was it.  It would not turn on anymore.  That is a very poor durability compare to the previous Canon that I had that lasted 10 years and used for many trips before it died. There is about 30% of the reviews on Amazon that give this camera one star for the same reason, it died after a month or less of usage.  My recommendation, buy another brand.  Panasonic have a serious problem of durability and QC on this product.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera, broke after being underwater
Reviews.Author: Rajo
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for about two years. During this time, it took great pictures above water and underwater (e.g., pool). I have been happy with performance. Recently, it was dropped onto the beach when getting out of a kayak. At that time, water got into the camera and it no longer turns on. My theory is that the water seal rings deteriorated over time.So, be careful putting it underwater after you've had it for a while. Given the price I paid for it, I am disappointed that it broke.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...totally recommend!
Reviews.Author: Angie Brady "amb0427"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on a trip to St. Kitts-- I took my big fancy camera and this camera and ended up taking all my pictures with this camera-- it does great and its in and under water functions are awesome!I've just started using this camera for all my picture taking needs!Headed to Turks this fall and can't wait to use it then :)I totally recommend this camera for anyone looking for a digital camera that is waterproof.

Reviews.Title: perfect for the traveler
Reviews.Author: Kristin
Reviews.Content: We bought this canberra over two years ago. It has since been all over the world. We have another digital camera and a video camera, but we haven't touched either of these since we made this purchase.We use it for everything. We snorkel with it constantly, use it for day to day photos and video. It withstands great temperature changes, is great in the water, withstands my husband dropping it and banging it into rocks and takes great photos.We've used it for weeks straight in almost 100°F with no issues.We've used it for hours in 30°F with no issues.We've used it in salt water and fresh water for weeks on end with no trouble. (we do soak it in fresh water for 20 min after each use).It's been dropped from about 4-5 feet repeatedly and bumped into rocks with no trouble, other than cosmetic scratches and dents.It's been dragged through sand with no issues.Really, I would never use another camera. It's so nice to know that if I get caught in a rain storm or drop it that I have no reason to worry.The photo quality is great. You will need to play around with the two water settings depending on the depth, lighting and what you're photographing, but once you get it set to your situation you're fine.The sunset setting always makes the sunsets look better than they really are, which my husband loves.The firework setting is the only one that is a little iffy. It just seems to struggle with clarity on that one.As a previous reviewer mentioned, it is easy to put your finger in front of the lens. You just need to be mindful.Overall, top notch product that I have yet to find another that compares. We really did a lot of research before this purchase and it paid off. Hopefully this will help others do the same.

Reviews.Title: Main reason to get it was for the GPS signature
Reviews.Author: Josip Juraj Strossmayer
Reviews.Content: ... And that is the feature which seldom works. (Under open skies, I should add.) While the camera was under warranty, I called about the inability to lock onto satellites. They recommended complete factory reset, which somehow works, but not always and of course, all the various settings made and already forgotten about, ale lost. It certainly is a good camera for taking pictures, but since I did get it because of the GPS and that is disappointing, I cannot rate it very high.

Reviews.Title: It IS rugged
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Blackwell
Reviews.Content: I purchased this when I was in Florida, so that I could take a camera to the beach and not worry about it. The photo quality is great.And you may ask yourself, how do you know it is rugged? Well, I just got back from an Alaskan cruise. We took a train tour in Skagway, AK on the Yukon and White Pass Rail Road. While going over the last bridge (over the area called "Gorge"), the camera slipped from my wrist - I was bundled up at the time, so it's not the fault of the camera strap - and it bounced. Several times. Off the train platform, then off of the tracks and railroad ties, before plunging into said gorge. It didn't break! Perhaps some brown bear is now taking pictures of her family, I don't know. But, I would definitely buy this product again.P.S. I was switching between this and my Nikon D3000 with zoom lens, so that I could take wide angle shots with the Panasonic. So not all of my photos were lost :)

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof for long
Reviews.Author: Eduardo J. Zambrano
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera and the software to move pictures from camera to PC is very nice.But the third time water touched it stop working all together. I didn't took it more than 1 meter (3 feets) underwater it and never worked again.Sorry Panasonic, thanks to you Olympus is getting a chance to prove itself as a though camera. You are out.

Reviews.Title: Great until it goes wrong...
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that I could take snorkeling, and would give me images of at least the same quality as my Lumix TZ1 (which I still love.) Trusting the brand, this model seemed to fit the bill perfectly. Its feature list was best in class, and claimed waterproof depth was significantly higher. The optical zoom was a little less than best in class, but not much.I had this camera for 15 months and used it underwater about 15 times, taking around 1200 photos while snorkeling, sailing and kayaking. Almost all of the photos were taken within 6ft depth. I was generally happy with most of the raw photos it took, and very pleased with how they looked after editing in Lightroom. Limitations I found were with focusing - a lot of pictures were slightly off when I zoomed in; and dynamic range - a tendency for bleaching out the bright areas. Performance on land was OK but nothing special. I think the TZ1 trumps it for low light every time.The GPS feature is, frankly, a waste of money. Not very accurate when it does work, which is sporadically.The movie quality is ok, but the sound is awful.And now the real con to this camera: reliability. The first week I had it, I lost all of my photos because it corrupted the memory card. And yes, the card was fine and functional before I used it in this camera.Now if you're reading this review before buying this model or its successor with the same basic body design: beware. I also came across many reviews complaining of the waterproof seal failing and killing the camera, and was inclined to think they had just not cleaned the seal or something. Not so. I used this camera twice at 12ft and both times it leaked. The first time was without incident, but the second was fatal. And of course, it's 3 months out of warranty... This time I think I'm going with a Pentax.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC TS3
Reviews.Author: M. R. Barrows
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for a trip to the Bahamas last year where I did some snorkeling.  Never went more than 3 feet underwater.  The camera worked well for the day and I got some ok pictures out of the water and fairly decent underwater coral pictures and short movies.  Took the camera back to the house and rinsed it off per the manual and let it dry. Tried to take pictures the next day (out of the water)and started getting error messages.  Opened the door and had water come out so I let it dry out with the door open, battery and card removed.  Fired up with no problem 2 days later and used in and out of the water, but started getting errors again.  Found water inside yet again.  Luckily, I was able to retrieve the pictures from the card. I carefully inspected the seal and found nothing, no nicks, cuts, foreign matter etc. Sent back to Panasonic and they replaced the motherboard and seal.  Was able to take pictures out of the water just fine for a year after i got it back.Outdoor pictures are ok. Not as good as my Pentax K-7 and I didn't expect them to be. Interior pictures tend to be dark.  The pictures I took underwater were also pretty good for the most part.Took it to Hawaii this year and within 5 minutes of being in the water, dead.  Verified the door seal had been locked correctly before I went in the water and even after I got out.  Never went below 2 feet. Water poured out of the battery and card compartment.  Not sure where or how the water is getting into the camera, but at this point, since the camera is out of warranty, I will not be sending back to Panasonic for repair.  Recycled Trash is the only good resting place.So, I will not be purchasing another "underwater" camera like the Panasonic.  Cheap disposables, or renting one with a proper underwater housing is the only thing I will do.  Could have saved myself $250.

Reviews.Title: Best Underwater Camera Out There!
Reviews.Author: Jenn in DC
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera in 2011 after a cruise.  We knew we would take one a year, at least, and we would be heavy into underwater activities - snorkeling mostly.  It worked like a dream in 2011.  Last cruise, we forgot to pack it.  HUGE mistake.  We had to buy one on the ship and the thing got waterlogged and broke in less than 6 months.  We're very careful with our cameras and are anal retentive about cleaning them so it wasn't user error.  Anyway, on our latest cruise, we had FIVE water excursions and used the camera for each one.  It takes wonderful photos on land.  So that is a plus.  Underwater, it's easy to see the screen so you know what you are pointing at.  It takes in colors well, even without sunlight.  I've now used about 4 underwater cameras and our Panasonic Lumix is the favorite by far!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Fit
Reviews.Author: Gam3rHav3n
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that could go surfing with me. I wanted a camera to go snowboarding with me. I needed a camera I did not have to worry about breaking or drowning. This is the perfect fit. It has been 2 years and it still works great with no issues. It takes amazing pictures and I find that I have my camera more often then my Wife with her big ole professional one because it is durable and easy to bring with me everywhere. No complaints great product.

Reviews.Title: AVOID THIS CAMERA !!!!  IT DOES LEAK !!!
Reviews.Author: igotthelife!!!
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures until you get it wet. I bought this camera a little over 13 months ago. I went on my first snorkel trip last week and the camera display started flickering. It now will take pictures out of the water but cannot play back the pictures or changing any of the settings is impossible due to the flickering display.  I contacted Panasonic and if it was under the 1 year, no problem, free exchange. Mine is 1 month out of warranty so it will cost $188! Almost as much as a new one!  If you do buy this after reading all the similar reviews noting this same problem, I suggest immediately taking a scuba trip! Don't wait like I did :(

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Denise M Harwood
Reviews.Content: We purchased this for underwater pictures on our vacation.  You have to be VERY still (which is difficult when water is splashing against you) but the camera performed beautifully.  We followed all the guidelines for rinsing after using in saltwater and pool water and haven't had any problems.  I don't find it quite as easy to use as our other camera, but my husband likes it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, poor software
Reviews.Author: Anjo108
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera but the software is not very user friendly.the Firmware update is none.the newer model have the same specs, changes only the software which u can do time laps pics and other functions.I wish they can upgrade the software in this model too so I dont need to buy an identical device just for a additional function.

Reviews.Title: GOOD CAMERA
Reviews.Author: CHILLINTHEMOST
Reviews.Content: Good Camera. Tough and waterproof. Used it for fishing/kayaking/tubing/the beach/boating/ice fishing/hunting and I've had zero problems with it. It take good pictures and movies. The display screen on the camera doesn't do the actual pictures justice. So if they look low quality on the camera don't worry.

Reviews.Title: Great functionality but it fogs up.
Reviews.Author: Jason Norgan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product about a year ago, and was very excited to use it. I must admit it is extremely versatile, both stills and video are great quality. However, I experienced issues when transitioning from water to dry elements. The camera fogged up and did not clear for some time. All images taken afterwards were foggy, basically worthless. At first I thought it was just an isolated incident, but when exposed to the same conditions the issue repeated. I have double checked the seals, and cleaned the camera as directed, but I keep experiencing fogginess after removing the camera from the water. Utilizing the camera in either environment by itself is fine, just don't expect to be able to use it about 15 minutes after getting out of the water.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Hardy Pinto
Reviews.Content: Only used it underwater once, but the image is great!The GPS was kind of slow to update, but since the last firmware upgrade (look for it at Panasonic site!!!) it is great...This is my camera #2 right now... the one I take when I don't want to walk around with my nikon D3100 on my neck!

Reviews.Title: Completely in love
Reviews.Author: K. Crepin "designer"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera insanely!Of all the waterproof cameras out there I settled on this one because I like the lumix line of cameras and I had a nikon coolpix that simply sucked at image quality, I assumed the waterproof coolpix would be similar so I chose this one instead. The quality is wonderful, it's very rugged. I dropped it twice, once was pretty bad. Fell on my boot and flew outward from there, apart from a few cosmetic nicks, it's still good as new. If you really want a through review go to dpreview's website.As for me, all I can say is I love it.I've been to the beach and waterfalls countless times since, pools everywhere with water, and also it takes some wonderful landscapes. The wide-angle is perfect for that, the colours come out rich and vibrant, without being too saturated. The detail is great. Video is awesome. Not good for zooming in obviously, so don't go bird watching. But if you're a hiker, trail runner or outdoors-er, this camera is great!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for 1 year, then flooded
Reviews.Author: T. Stewart "ER VET"
Reviews.Content: This was a great little camera capturing incredible underwater and on land pictures (for its size.) Then, exactly 1 year after the purchase I was using the camera in a controlled pool environment and it flooded. If this is an anomaly, then the camera is great, but beware.

Reviews.Title: YEP. It does leak, but seems to recover...
Reviews.Author: polishp
Reviews.Content: We bought this specifically for snorkeling on our honeymoon. I followed all the directions regarding the seal and care and preparations and after care regarding soaking and drying. On the first swim, about a few hours after we got out, the playback function started getting wonky, flashing something about the dimensions of the AV input. It seemed to go away after it dried out a bit. Each swim got progressively worse, a few hours out of the water, it would have playback errors, then eventually shut off all together. At one point the lens seemed to fog from the inside. But after sitting for a day, with silica pellets inside the battery cavity, it made a full recovery. On one of the later failures, I did open the hatch to see what was up, and found the A/V port to be corroded and crusted. Salt water definitely got in, which explains the flickering playback messages. Luckily it did't get to the card or battery. So we got lucky...The camera takes excellent macro shots, which is one of the reason I got it. And the pics we got while snorkeling were awesome. Wish we could have used the camera everyday without it's "time outs".Just be prepared for issues with the waterproof quality. But I still like the camera.

Reviews.Title: Travel Light
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: Originally I was looking for a SLR Camera for our vacation. As vacations are special events, you want to take great shots. Problem, I hate to carry a lot with me and look like a tourist! I friend who is a camera expert, taking pictures of birds as a hobby, recommended the Panasonic Lumix TS3.Well, after 19 days in Europe and well over 300 pictures, this camera was great! Majority of the shots were SLR quality, the waterproof feature came in handy when we went for a swim in the ocean and took some underwater shots.The GPS featue was great! The only complaint I had and it was a personal one - I had to get use to where the lense was located. Took some thumb shots.This year we're heading back and looking forward to my TS3 on this trip.

Reviews.Title: Discontinued model.
Reviews.Author: RickG "Rick"
Reviews.Content: Discontinued model.This never leaked but I'm very careful with the seals and keep them covered with a slight amount of Divers Silocone paste.

Reviews.Title: buena camara
Reviews.Author: Hernan Barbecho
Reviews.Content: Buenas fotos, excelente durabilidad y peso ligero, buena acompañante para la aventura... facil manejo y configuracionRecomendada 100% experiencia unica

Reviews.Title: I am so impressed!
Reviews.Author: Melissa B
Reviews.Content: I was going to Grand Cayman, and wanted a camera that could travel well, put up with a bit of sand and water, and take photos that were decent. I did a ton of on-line research, and although this camera was not the newest on the market OR rated the highest OR the least expensive, the consumer and professional reviews I read consistently gave it high marks. I ordered the camera about three weeks before my trip, believing that there would be a learning curve, but the camera was very intuitive and it was super easy to master the basics. I took it on the trip, and although I was nervous about actually using it under water, it worked great, and I got some fabulous pics of stingrays and conch shells! I was totally impressed that a poor photographer like myself could get such great quality shots! I think it's not only the technology within the camera, but also the Leica lens; my photos look professional. I have also taken videos with the camera, and they have also come out fantastic, although the HD recordings make huge files (400MB for a 2.5 minute video). I highly recommend this camera, but suggest that you compare prices before buying, 'cause I've noticed that the cost is all over the board; some of the price differences seem to be based upon the color of the camera, which makes no sense to me at all, but I found the best price on the blue case.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater pics but did not last
Reviews.Author: C. Hernandez "Vinyl Reborn"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when it first came out specifically for underwater use at the great barrier reef.  It worked very well and feel the pics and video underwater was better than expected.  The shots were clear and got pics of nemo and great memories.  It also took decent pictures during daylight but less than average quality at night.  After the Australia trip, I only used the camera above water and sporadically light.  Last month, I traveled  to the tropics and took the camera to the beach.  To my surprise water got inside the camera and it shut down for good.  I think the camera lid may not have snapped in all the way but it appeared to be closed with the extra security switch. Either that or the seal failed.  In hindsight, the locking mechanism is a serious flaw on this camera.  I really love the ability to take pictures underwater, so picked up a good deal on the equivalent Nikon camera (AW100).  I quickly noted that the locking mechanism on the Nikon is far superior and full proof relative to the Panasonic.  While I have not tested the Nikon underwater, I did get it wet and encountered no problems.  But I can tell you that above water it is far superior in picture quality and particularly using the scene settings.  It also does great at night, where the Panasonic did a poor job.  At any rate, while the Ts3 now is an old and replaced camera, i think the locking mechanism of the latest model has not changed.  I would not purchased this product again from Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: I makes a good paper weight
Reviews.Author: Geoff
Reviews.Content: I bought the Panasonic Lumix DMC TS3 new from Best Buy in January of 2012 to take with me on vacation to Belize in February. I took a few photos with it prior to the trip and it worked fine. When we arrived in Belize the first time I tried to take a photo the camera would turn on but and the screen would light up but it would not take a picture. When I returned to Canada I took it back to Best Buy and they would not exchange it and gave me a mailing address to send it to. I mailed the camera, at my cost, and it was returned 6 weeks later. I took a few more photos and it worked fine. I then put it away. In February 2013 I took the camera to Belize again and it took about a dozen photos before it quit working again this time telling me that the SD card had to be reinstalled. I tried several different cards but the camera always gave me the same error message until eventually the screen just quit illuminating. I have taken less than 25 photos with this camera. I wanted to just throw it out into the ocean but I don't like to litter. I brought it home and plan on throwing it into recycling. I tried to put a review on the Best Buy site but it appears they do not carry this camera anymore.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Eric BVD "Eric"
Reviews.Content: Died in the waters Hawaii on a swim, took okay photos, on the bulky side, and GPS sort of worked.

Reviews.Title: I'm enjoying this
Reviews.Author: Tim Orel
Reviews.Content: I haven't had it long, but I do think that it has a lot of features that I'll enjoy.  It takes decent pictures underwater in a pool and I'm looking forward to trying it in the sea.  There are extra neat features for 3D and geotagging that I'm also going to have fun with.  The only thing I wish was that it had a longer optical zoom, but I understand why that's not possible with a ruggedized camera where everything needs to be kept internal.  It looks like it will meet my goal of having a small, rugged camera with lots of features.  It also finally gives me a reason to go buy a 3D TV.  I've also discovered my computer video card can also do 3D, so I may need a 3D monitor as well.In comparing this to my Fuji, the pictures have a different cast to them - a bit more blue.  I don't know if that's a setting that I need to tweak or if that's just how things will be.  I'm not going to down-rate it just because I don't know how to do a setting.

Reviews.Title: 3 Strikes and Your Out
Reviews.Author: Island Mama "Suze"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the TS-2 which leaked and fogged while snorkeling. Sent it back to Panasonic and they replaced it with the TS-3 which still fogged and leaked while snorkeling and has now completely stopped working. I purchased my wife the new TS-4 hoping they had all of the problems resolved and it fogs terrible as well. None of these have ever been used for anything but snorkeling in warm water and always rinsed and cleaned as the owners manual states. We have several friends with the same camera's experiencing the same issues. I will NEVER buy another Panasonic "waterproof camera"

Reviews.Title: Best in class.
Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: Images can be grainy in low light, but for a simple point and shoot that allows you to jump off waterfalls while taking 1080 video, unbeatable.Key learning in the tropics: high humidity air will penetrate the camera while the door is open for memory card and battery swaps. With humidity in the case, moving in and out of water or sunshine can cause the screen and lens to fog over, blurring the images. I solved this problem on the road by holding the camera in front of the car's dash vent with the AC on for about 15 minutes (also in hotel rooms). The dry air from tha AC replaced the moisture in the camera and no more fog problems.

Reviews.Title: it ok
Reviews.Author: pokat
Reviews.Content: This camera is waterprook yes, which is nice to have but it does not take very good pictures when it is not in the water. look elsewhere for a better quality picture.

Reviews.Title: The best point and shot i ever had !!
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Venosa Jr.
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing! Take pictures magnificent! The picture quality is phenomenal. Video recorded underwater was amazing. I recommend this camera too, was the best I've ever bought ! Very well done Panasonic !! Congratulations !! I'm very pleased with it !!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: We wanted to purchase a camera that will take underwater photos.  This camera took GREAT underwater pictures.  In fact, it took great pictures out of the water as well.  We recently took it on vacation and only brought this compact camera instead of our larger camera with multiple lenses, etc.  We were pleasantly surprised at how great the pictures turned out.  If you have trouble with your mask fogging up, keep the camera on the wide angle setting so you can see it a little better on the screen.  We highly recommend this camera!!!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding durable camera, takes terrific shots and movies
Reviews.Author: Kyle Lawrence
Reviews.Content: When I went on my honeymoon to the Caribbean back in March, I knew I wanted a camera that was durable, was waterproof, and would capture the beauty of both the landscape of St. John as well as the beauty that lies beneath the surface of the water.  I was not disappointed at all.  With this camera, I was able to take hundreds of pictures underwater during various snorkeling stops, and caught a ton of movies of some of the local marine life (including sharks and barracuda!).If you're going to buy this, I definitely recommend buying the Chum thing (that yellow thing that causes the camera to float if you drop it.  If you're spend some money on a good waterproof camera, you need the flotation device as the camera will sink like a stone in a matter of seconds if dropped.If you're planning on buying this camera, make sure you familiarize yourself with how to properly take care of it.  For instance, after each underwater use (or really, anytime it is exposed to water be it at sea or in the elements), you need to soak the camera in cold tap water for 20 minutes, then open it up and let it dry.  There are numerous little maintenance tips that you'll need to familiarize yourself with but don't let this scare you off - it's worth it and once you get the hang of it, its easy.Happy shooting!

Reviews.Title: I love my Lumix
Reviews.Author: Holly
Reviews.Content: I noticed there are two different versions of this camera.  I have a feeling that the reviews here are from both versions instead of just the one.  Anyway, I have had my LumixDMc_TS3 for almost a year.  It is the one that says Full HD on the front in the bottom left corner.  I have had zero problems with it and we use it almost every day.  I have taken some really cool macro shots, many many underwater shots, and more.  I generally do my underwater shots with the continuous shot mode because my boys don't hold still for photos.  This isn't the best quality mode but even with that, I really have a lot of incredible pictures.  I don't know how the knewer version compares, but I know this version I have has been easy to take care of and easy to take great pictures with.

Reviews.Title: Very impressed
Reviews.Author: KiwiChick
Reviews.Content: I've recently bought this camera for our Cook Island honeymoon. We travel a lot and it is nice to have a camera you don't have to worry about. I also have dSLR and this one is a nice addition.I was very impressed with the quality of the pictures, especially the underwater ones that I took while snorkelling. It did help that the visibility in the shallow lagoon was great, but looking through the photos back home I was very happy with them, they are very sharp, and the colours are vibrant.I treat all my gear with utmost care and I make sure I always follow the instructions, soak and then dry it properly.I'm not one for reading manuals, maybe I should have, because it took my a while to find the +/- exposure buttons. The basic menu, eg how to change settings, is very easy to navigate though.I took a couple of videos snorkelling and on land (while riding a scooter ;) ) and I'm equally impressed with the video quality. Thats a great weeI've used the camera in the ocean, in the pool and in the rain and I am very happy with it and would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Overpriced For Mediocre Photos - Waterproof?
Reviews.Author: Lard Helmet "weephole"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera  early last summer in anticipation of a trip to Maui, which would include a lot of snorkeling. There were very few reviews at the time so I purchased the camera mostly on faith.I recieved it just prior to our departure,and used it extensively on land and in the water.By the end of the trip , the camera was no longer functioning - black screen - even though I had followed all of the immersion and post immersion procedures to a T.Upon returning home, I had to send it to Texas for repairs and didn't see it again for 3 months.While the camera was working, I took underwater vids, and still photos, on land and in the water. In my opinion, the photos were very good in bright sunlight, and mediocre to poor indoors, or in any kind of low lighting. The underwater videos were good as long as there was ample sunlight and we weren't too deep.Compared to the Sony Bloggie that one of our travel partner's brought along, the land videos weren't in the same league - the bloggie took much more vivid videos with less lense flare, and other weird abberations that the Lumix experienced, depending on the angle of the sun.All in all,I am very disappointed with the camera. I have an old Fuji finepix 3.5 megapixel camera and a Canon A630 8MP that take much better pictures, and land videos than the lumix.
